title: Harry Dunn's tearful dad begs for 'justice for my boy' in emotional plea
text:

The dad of teenager Harry Dunn who was killed in a car crash with a diplomat's wife has emotionally called for justice to be done.

The 19-year-old's father Tim urged the authorities to bring Anne Sacoolas back to the UK after she fled to the US.

The wife of US spy Jonathan Sacoolas claimed diplomatic immunity after the fatal smash near RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire and returned to her home country.

As pressure mounts on the American authorities to send Mrs Sacoolas back to the UK, Mr Dunn and mum Charlotte Charles flew to New York as part of a media blitz.

"Somewhere, somebody has made a decision to give this lady immunity," the distraught dad said.

(Image: Sky News)

"She's not entitled to immunity as it's been said and we've known that from the start.

"They made a mistake, someone has made a mistake.

"On that night there was an accident, a lady made a mistake, she killed our son, she didn't mean to kill him, she didn't mean to have an accident, but you cannot walk away from that and just leave and expect nothing to happen.

"Our boy died and he deserves to have some justice. That's all we want."

(Image: Sky News)

The greiving parent called on American President Donald Trump as a "man, as a father" to ensure Mrs Sacoolas was made to take responsibility for the crash.

He added: "I've always wanted to ask her if she could explain the moment of the crash, find out if she comforted Harry, if she spoke to Harry, find out what her movements were, did she try and call the emergency services?

"I'm just struggling because I can't imagine my lad being in the ditch and not having any comfort from anybody until the ambulance and police turn up 'X' minutes later.

(Image: PA)

(Image: Sky News)

"When we had the funeral, which was a lovely tribute to him, I thought maybe that was the time we were going to turn the corner, but then it wasn't until a week later when we found out that she had left the country and now it feels like it has gone right back to the night he died.

"There's just no way I can start grieving yet, as a family we can't start, we need this resolved."

Mrs Charles, the teenager's mother, said she had to put her grief "on hold" as the story of the 42-year-old's return to the US unfolded.

"All of our grief has gone on hold, it's coming out in other horrific ways, your legs feel like lead, you're in pain morning until night that no pain killers can take away," she said.

(Image: Sky News)

(Image: Sky News)

"You're not able to cry, because we can't understand this whole situation as to why she would have left us without wanting to meet us back then.

"She needs to get on the plane and get back to the UK, just do the right thing.

"It shouldn't be that difficult, it shouldn't have been this difficult, she surely didn't have to go."

(Image: Sky News)

Mrs Sacoolas' protection is now in dispute after Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab wrote to Harry's parents over the weekend, telling them the government had 'pressed strongly for a waiver of immunity, so that justice can be done.'

Ms Charles said before boarding her flight that she had received a letter from Mrs Sacoolas expressing her 'deepest sympathies and apologies'.

Mr Trump has shown little sign that he is willing for the American citizen to be tried abroad.
description: Tim Dunn and Charlotte Charles called for Anne Sacoolas to face justice following the death of their son near RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire
